titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Ryszard Gontarz collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff. Revised by Justyna K. Szulc

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-09-05T16:49-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Photocopies of Polish government and communist party documents, minutes, bulletins, reports, circulated material, and printed matter, relating to political conditions and secret service activities in Poland during the communist era.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ryszard Gontarz Collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2008, with an addition in 2014.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Involved in operations against anticommunist partisans
Employed in Department I of Ministry of Internal Affairs (M.S.W.)
Undercover agent of the Ministry of Internal Affairs
Informally connected with Security Services (S.B.) in his work as journalist
Active in press campaign against March revolt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of Polish government and communist party documents, minutes, bulletins, reports, circulated material, and printed matter, relating to political conditions and secret service activities in Poland during the communist era.

Documents starting from the middle of box 7 through box 13 form an addition under the series title Incremental Materials. The materials represented in the addition are composed of articles, correspondence, internal documents, newspaper clippings, photographs, writings and research materials. The increment is organized by the research topics that Ryszard Gontarz collected. Additionally, the research topics are organized by the original titles created by Gontarz: Czarna Teczka (Black Folder), Grudziń 1970 (December 1970 protests), Jedwabne (The Jedwabne massacre), Rudolf Kastner, Komandosi (The Commandos), Komitet Obrony Robotników (Workers’ Defence Committee), Kościół (Church), Lewica Patriotyczna (Leftist Patriotic Union), Marzec 1968 (Polish political crisis of March 1968), Polska Zjednoczona Partia Robotnicza (Polish United Workers’ Party), Solidarność (Solidarity), Ukraińska Powstańcz Armia (Ukrainian Insurgent Army), Wojna Domowa (Civil War), and Zbrodnie Bermanowskie (Bermanian Crimes – referring to Jakub Berman). Additionally, there is a general Research Material category of documents that the creator kept separate. Materials in this category are composed of documents and writings pertaining to emigration and repatriotization, Władysław Gomułka, PRL (Polish People’s Republic), the views of western press on Poland, as well as articles, writings, and notes of Ryszard Gontarz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials represented in this section are composed of articles, correspondence, internal documents, newspaper clippings, photographs, writings and research materials. The increment is organized by the research topics that Ryszard Gontarz collected. Additionally, the research topics are organized by the original titles created by Gontarz: Czarna Teczka (Black Folder), Grudziń 1970 (December 1970 protests), Jedwabne (The Jedwabne massacre), Rudolf Kastner, Komandosi (The Commandos), Komitet Obrony Robotników (Workers’ Defence Committee), Kościół (Church), Lewica Patriotyczna (Leftist Patriotic Union), Marzec 1968 (Polish political crisis of March 1968), Polska Zjednoczona Partia Robotnicza (Polish United Workers’ Party), Solidarność (Solidarity), Ukraińska Powstańcz Armia (Ukrainian Insurgent Army), Wojna Domowa (Civil War), and Zbrodnie Bermanowskie (Bermanian Crimes – referring to Jakub Berman). Additionally, there is a general Research Material category of documents that the creator kept separate. Materials in this category are composed of documents and writings pertaining to emigration and repatriotization, Władysław Gomułka, PRL (Polish People’s Republic), the views of western press on Poland, as well as articles, writings, and notes of Ryszard Gontarz.
